_learningOutcomes.outcome: Describe the open data publication phases
Identify a number of key processes to improve the sustainable publication of open data
Apply a number of open data guidelines to ensure open data becomes sustainable
Identify different characteristics in data and associated data formats
Justify approaches for publishing different types of data in different ways
Describe the data spectrum and how it applies to different types of data
Describe the importance of persistent identifiers for data
Apply the five stars of linked open data to analyse technical quality of data
Explain the difference between the data on the web and the web of data
List a number of patterns for discovering open data on and in the Web
Create search patterns that enable discovery of open data
Analyse the challenges in using existing open data
Analyse the benefits and drawbacks of publishing data on different open data platforms
Describe the approaches for publishing data
Differentiate between data catalogues, data portals and data management systems
Publish a number of datasets on different open data platforms
Create a process model for publishing different datasets
Explain how copyright is applied to intellectual works
Identify whether copyrighted material can be used under exception or open licence
Explain how copyright applies to data and databases
Evaluate the challenges in licensing data collected from third parties
Identify opportunities to apply viral licences
Identify compatible and equivalent licences
Differentiate between publically available and publicly usable data
Describe how the global legal system affects open data
Examine the potential to use open data as part of a business
Describe a number of companies that are innovating with open data
Analyse the risk in opening up data
Create a value proposition
Create a business model for an open data startup
Analyse an open data businesses potential and challenges in managing open data projects
Identify the stages and time requirements of an investigative open data project
Identify a number of different errors that exist in data
Clean a dataset
Enrich a dataset with available open data
Evaluate how emerging technologies can promote fast innovation and enable required change in business models
Describe the key benefits of visualising open data
Describe a number of key data visualisations
Differentiate between the various goals of visualising open data
Select the appropriate set of goals for specific open data visulisations
Describe a number of techniques for visulising different formats and structures of data
Describe the role of cognitive science in data visualisation
Critically evaluate how the human brain interprets information presented visually
Evaluate the effectiveness of 'pop-outs' in data visulisation
Evaluate the use of colour in visualising data
Describe the problems and potential solutions for visualising high-dimension datasets
Describe the techniques for visualising temporal data
Apply your knowledge of visualisation techniques to identify those which deliberately attempt to mislead their audience
Create a heatmap visulisation of education open data
Create an interactive spatial visulisation of open election data
Create an interactive treemap visualisation for open spending data
